title: Israeli settlers injure dozens of Palestinians in wave of West Bank attacks
desc: Latest attacks come amid a widely condemned Israeli push to cement control over the occupied Palestinian territory.

title: ISU defends controversial Olympic judging that denied Americans gold medal
desc: The International Skating Union defended a controversial Olympic judge after Madison Chock and Evan Bates lost the gold medal by a narrow margin to the French duo in ice dance.

title: Why is Bezos trolling Musk on X with turtle pics? Because he has a new Moon plan.
desc: It’s time to go back to the Moon—this time to stay."

title: Charles Leclerc sets the morning pace on second day of Bahrain pre
desc: Charles Leclerc was the pacesetter during the second morning of pre-season testing in Bahrain, heading Lando Norris and Pierre Gasly at the top of the timesheets.

title: Afcon 2027: Finals in Kenya, Tanzania and Uganda set for June-July slot
desc: Afcon 2027 will be held in June and July next year and reports the finals could be delayed are "totally unfounded", says African football boss Patrice Motsepe.

title: Coach jailed for nine years for rape of 14
desc: A horse riding coach in his 60s who abused his position of trust by raping a 14-year-old girl, after having groomed her by giving her alcohol and equestrian clothing, has been jailed for nine years.

title: 'Terminator Zero' Canceled After One Season at Netflix
desc: The Netflix anime series "Terminator Zero" has been canceled after one season, series creator Mattson Tomlin has revealed.

title: Britney Spears Seen Out for First Time Since Selling Music Catalog
desc: Britney Spears is carrying on as if nothing happened ... spotted doing everyday errands like she didn’t just cash in one of the most iconic catalogs in pop history.

title: Lorna Luxe: Stars pay tribute to her husband John Andrew's death
desc: Luxe announced his death to her 1.7 million Instagram followers, saying she was "heartbroken".
